parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: The sort direction (asc, desc). Default is `asc`

parameters.description: Bounding box of the records requested. Format should be: lat,long,lat,long (bottom, left, top, right).

parameters.name: changeset_id
parameters.description: The id of the changeset associated with the record.

parameters.name: form_id
parameters.description: The id of the form with which the record is associated. Leaving this blank will query against all of your records.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The id of the project with which the record is associated. Leaving this blank will query against all of your records.

parameters.name: client_created_before
parameters.description: Return only records which were created by the client (device) before the given time.

parameters.name: client_created_since
parameters.description: Return only records which were created by the client (device) after the given time.

parameters.name: client_updated_before
parameters.description: Return only records which were updated by the client (device) before the given time.

parameters.name: client_updated_since
parameters.description: Return only records which were updated by the client (device) after the given time.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Return only records which were created (on the server) before the given time.

parameters.name: created_since
parameters.description: Return only records which were created (on the server) after the given time.

parameters.name: updated_before
parameters.description: Return only records which were updated (on the server) before the given time.

parameters.name: updated_since
parameters.description: Return only records which were updated (on the server) after the given time.

get.description: This endpoint can help you get records from a specific changeset, or retrieve records for a deleted form.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of classification sets to return

parameters.name: record_id
parameters.description: The ID of the record with which the photo is associated.

parameters.name: form_id
parameters.description: The ID of the form with which the photo is associated. Leaving this blank will query against all of your photos.

parameters.name: newest_first
parameters.description: If present, photos will be sorted by updated_at date.

code-samples.code:
from fulcrum import Fulcrum
fulcrum = Fulcrum('{token}')

photo = fulcrum.photos.create('/Users/bryan/Desktop/photo.jpg')
print(photo['photo'])
code-samples.name: Python
JavaScript

code-samples.code:
require 'fulcrum'

client = Fulcrum::Client.new('{token}')

photo = client.photos.create('/Users/bryan/Desktop/photo.jpg')

puts photo
code-samples.name: Ruby

parameters.name: record_id
parameters.description: The ID of the record with which the photo is associated.

parameters.name: form_id
parameters.description: The ID of the form with which the photo is associated. Leaving this blank will query against all of your photos.

parameters.name: newest_first
parameters.description: If present, photos will be sorted by updated_at date.

parameters.name: record_id
parameters.description: The ID of the record with which the attachment is associated. This is required when listing record attachments.

parameters.name: form_id
parameters.description: The ID of the form with which the attachment is associated. This parameter will allow you to get all reference files within a form, NOT all of the record attachments in a form

parameters.name: owner_type
parameters.description: The type of attachment to query for. Must be either `form` or `record`.

parameters.name: x-apitoken
parameters.description: API Token. Required to authenticate the request.

post.description: There is only one parameter that is required for creating an attachment: `owners`. You must specify at least one owner of type `record` or `form`. If you create a `record` attachment you can optionally include a `name` and `file_size`. The name will be the name of the file shown in the record information. The file_size is only used for verifying that uploading this attachment will not exceed your current storage limit. If no file_size is provided the attachment may be rejected once it has been uploaded. The response will provide the `url` to upload (PUT) the file to.

parameters.name: x-apitoken
parameters.description: API Token. Required to authenticate the request.

parameters.name: x-apitoken
parameters.description: API Token. Required to authenticate the request.

delete.description: The delete endpoint only applies to Form attachments. Use this endpoint to delete an attachment. For record attachments, simply remove the association of an attachment from the record and the attachment will be deleted.

parameters.name: x-apitoken
parameters.description: API Token. Required to authenticate the request.

post.description: The finalize endpoint is a required step for Form attachments. Use this endpoint to tell Fulcrum that your attachment has been uploaded.

parameters.name: x-apitoken
parameters.description: API Token. Required to authenticate the request.

webhook.errors: Invalid JSON structure. Did you remember to add the "Content-Type: application/json" header?

parameters.name: activity
parameters.description: The available actions vary by log type but a complete list of valid actions includes: `update`, `create`, `permission_update`, `download`, `delete`, `reset`, `share_enabled`, `share_disabled`, `update_credit_card`, `plan_change`, `billing_emails_change`, `update_storage`, `add_credit`, `change_default`.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: Filter by ip address of the of the audit log action. The ip address must be an exact match in order to return in values from this filter.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Filter by user responsible for the logged changes. This parameter must be the Fulcrum resource id for the user in question, which can be obtained from the membership API.

parameters.name: updated_since
parameters.description: Returns log entries since the given unix timestamp.

parameters.name: updated_before
parameters.description: Returns log entries before the given unix timestamp.

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: One of DESC for descending or ASC for ascending

post.summary: Create Batch to Bulk Delete Records
post.description: Using the batch operations API, you can bulk delete records from a form.
Using the batch operations API, you can bulk delete records from a form or update project, assignee, or status values on multiple records.

parameters.name: form_id
parameters.description: The form to fetch reports for
